page.title: 06ROADS
page.content:
Most of the roads in the Thrussington & Hoby area are very narrow. There are verges & hedgerows beside the road. Also there are dykes at the side of the road so that when it rains the water flows into them.All these roads are tarmaced but there are many roads that lead to farms in the area which are just tracks and so have no surface on them.
Trees and hedges are very important to wildlife.This is because the wildlife need to nest and lay in them.
There is only one main road going through this area & that is the A607 from Melton Mowbray to Leicester.
Hoby village is a long village built around a bendy road.
